name: Finite-State-Third-Party-Upload
description: The `third-party-upload` Github Action allows you to integrate Finite State's third-party upload scanning capabilities into your workflow.
author: Christian Pfarher

inputs.name: finiteStateOrganizationContext
inputs.label: Finite State Organization Context
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Organization-Context should have been provided to you by your Finite State representative and looks like xxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx

inputs.name: assetId
inputs.label: Asset ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Asset ID for the asset that the new asset version will belong to

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the asset version that will be created

inputs.name: filePath
inputs.label: File path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local path of the file to be uploaded

inputs.name: testType
inputs.label: Test Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: For the full list of supported upload types, review [this list](https://docs.finitestate.io/supported-file-types).

inputs.name: automaticComment
inputs.label: Automatic Comment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Defaults to false. If it is true, it will generate a comment in the PR with the link to the Asset version URL in the Finite State Platform.

inputs.name: businessUnitId
inputs.label: Business Unit ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (optional) ID of the business unit that the asset version will belong to. If not provided, the asset version will adopt the existing business unit of the asset.

inputs.name: createdByUserId
inputs.label: Created By User ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (optional) ID of the user to be recorded as the 'Created By User' on the asset version. If not provided, the version will adopt the existing value of the asset.

inputs.name: productId
inputs.label: Product ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (optional) ID of the product that the asset version will belong to. If not provided, the existing product for the asset will be used, if applicable.
